SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Shapes
Class BezierSurface

java.lang.Object
  SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Node
      SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Shapes.Shape
          SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Shapes.BezierSurface
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGL_Renderable
public class BezierSurface
extends Shape

This class draws a Bezier surface patch. The shape of the Bezier surface is determined by forming weighted averages of the points in the two dimensional array of control points. If the two dimensional array of control points is viewed with the column numbers increasing to the right and the row numbers increasing in the upward direction, then the front face of the surface should be visible. When viewed this way, the texture coordinates of the surface will have the "s" coordinate increasing to the right and the "t" coordinate increasing in the upward direction. The default range for texture coordinates is from (0,0) in the lower left hand corner, to (1,1) in the upper right hand corner. The maximum values to use for the "s" and "t" coordinates can be specified by calling the setMax_s() and setMax_t() methods, before rendering the surface. By default, the surface will be evaluated using 10 intermediate points in the "u" direction (increasing row number) and "v" direction (increasing column number). The number of points to evaluate in the "u" and "v" directions can be altered by calling the setNum_u() and setNum_v() methods. NOTE: The number of rows and columns in the array of control points must not exceed the value specified by the OpenGL constant GL_MAX_EVAL_ORDER. The maximum number of rows and columns allowed depends on the OpenGL implementation, but must be at least 8. This is checked when the surface is rendered, and a warning message will be printed if the maximum is exceeded.

Constructor Detail

BezierSurface

public BezierSurface(Vector3D[][] points)
Construct a BezierSurface object with the specified control points.

Parameters:
points - A two dimensional "rectangular" array of control points. There must be at least one row and at least one column. Also, each row must have the same number of points.

BezierSurface

public BezierSurface(Vector3D[][] points,
                     int num_us,
                     int num_vs)
Construct a BezierSurface object with the specified control points.

Parameters:
num_us - The number of u values used when evaluating the surface. The value of u varies from 0 to 1 in the "direction" of increasing row number.
num_vs - The number of v values used when evaluating the surface The value of v varies from 0 to 1 in the "direction" of increasing column number.
points - A two dimensional "rectangular" array of control points. There must be at least one row and at least one column. Also, each row must have the same number of points.

public void setMax_s(float max_s)
Set the maximum "s" texture coordinate value to use, if the explicitly generated texture coordinates are not overridden by texture coordinates generated by OpenGL due to calling Shape.setTexCoordGenMode().

Parameters:
max_s - the maximum texture coordinate "s" that is generated.

setNum_u

public void setNum_u(int num_u)
Set the number of points at which the surface is evaluated in the "u" direction (direction of increasing row number). If the specified number is less than 1, the default value of 10 will be used.

Parameters:
num_u - the number of point to use in the "u" direction. This must be at least 1, or the default value of 10 will be used.

getNum_u

public int getNum_u()
Get the currently set value for number of points to evaluate in the "u" direction.

Returns:
num_u the number of points evaluated in the "u" direction.

setNum_v

public void setNum_v(int num_v)
Set the number of points at which the surface is evaluated in the "v" direction (direction of increasing column number). If the specified number is less than 1, the default value of 10 will be used.

Parameters:
num_v - the number of point to use in the "v" direction. This must be at least 1, or the default value of 10 will be used.
